New Records: Parker Meadows tied Tigers legend Charlie Gehringer with a seven-game hit streak to start his postseason career, the longest in team history.
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas hit a grand slam off Tarik Skubal in the bottom of the fifth inning.
David Fry hit a home run in Game 4.
Spencer Torkelson hit two doubles in the game.
Kerry Carpenter hit an RBI double off the base of the right field wall.
Jake Rogers hit a line drive single to right field to score Spencer Torkelson.
Colt Keith hit an RBI double off the wall in straightaway center field.
Bryan Rocchio hit an RBI single in the bottom of the eighth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: AJ Hinch stocked his lineup with right-handers to try and jump Matt Boyd for an early lead.
Post-Match Reflections: The Tigers will head home after a very successful season and the most shocking and exciting stretch drive in team history.
Scott Harris' job is to bolster the rotation and find more power in the lineup for 2025.
The Tigers' clutch magic over the last 10 weeks has been incredible.
The future looks very bright for the Detroit Tigers.
Congrats to the Cleveland Guardians. Hopefully this is the beginning of a great rivalry between the two squads.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians advanced to the ALCS to take on the New York Yankees.
The Tigers hit three balls off the wall in the game.
The Guardians held off some late threats to win 7-3.
The Tigers had plenty of baserunners but couldn't get those seeing-eye ground balls.
